tool.name: VarScan copynumber
tool.description: Determine relative tumor copy number from tumor-normal pileups

param.name: min_coverage
param.label: Minimum read depth
param.help: Minimum coverage threshold for copynumber segments

param.name: min_base_qual
param.label: Minimum base quality to count for coverage

param.name: min_map_qual
param.label: Minimum read mapping quality to count for coverage

param.name: min_segment_size
param.label: Minimum number of consecutive bases to report a segment

param.name: max_segment_size
param.label: Max size before a new segment is made

expand.label: P-value threshold for significant copynumber change-point

param.name: data_ratio
param.label: The normal/tumor input data ratio for copynumber adjustment

param.name: sample_names
param.help: Separate sample names by comma; leave blank to use default sample names.

tool.help:
**VarScan Overview**
VarScan_ performs variant detection for massively parallel sequencing data, such as exome, WGS, and transcriptome data. It calls variants from a mpileup dataset and produces a VCF 4.1 Full documentation is available online_.
This tool in particular is estimating the relative tumor copy number from tumor-normal pileups.
.. _VarScan: http://dkoboldt.github.io/varscan/ .. _online: http://dkoboldt.github.io/varscan/using-varscan.html
**Input**
::
mpileup file - The SAMtools mpileup files for the normal and tumor tissue
**Output**
VarScan produces a VCF 4.1 dataset as output.
